feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence listing settings panel layout change and 3D piece updates with associated files and metadata.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Text file containing prewritten summaries for various frontend source files.
frontend/index.html: Basic HTML page setting up root element and loading main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React component handling game UI layout, settings, restart confirmation, and board rendering.
frontend/src/features/chess/ai/evaluatio: Evaluates board positions using material, piece-square tables, and personality-based weights.
frontend/src/features/chess/ai/getAiMove: Wrapper returning the AI-selected move using the search algorithm.
frontend/src/features/chess/ai/search.ts: Minimax search with alpha-beta pruning and difficulty-based depth/randomness to pick AI moves.
frontend/src/features/chess/animation/an: Type definition for animated moves including squares and timing.
frontend/src/features/chess/board2d/Boar: Renders 2D board grid with pieces, selection, legal move markers, animations, and last-move highlighting.
frontend/src/features/chess/board2d/piec: Displays 2D chess pieces using Unicode symbols.
frontend/src/features/chess/board3d/Boar: Renders the 3D chessboard using react-three-fiber, including lighting, camera, controls, and animated piece movement. Delegates board square and piece rendering to Board3DScene with animation helpers.
frontend/src/features/chess/board3d/piec: Defines 3D models for each chess piece type using basic geometries and materials. Returns grouped meshes styled based on piece type and color.
frontend/src/features/chess/engine/chess: Provides chess rule utilities including coordinate conversion, initial setup, attack detection, and piece move generation. Supports sliding moves, pawn rules, and game state initialization.
frontend/src/features/chess/engine/types: Defines TypeScript types for pieces, squares, moves, game status, and overall game state. Used throughout the chess engine and UI.
frontend/src/features/chess/settings/Res: Shows a confirmation dialog warning that changing settings will restart the game. Provides confirm and cancel actions.
frontend/src/features/chess/settings/Set: UI panel for adjusting board mode, difficulty, personality, and player name. Uses select inputs and emits change callbacks.
frontend/src/features/chess/settings/typ: Defines simple union types for board mode, difficulty, and AI personality settings.
frontend/src/features/chess/state/useChe: Custom hook managing full chess game state, including move selection, AI turns, move execution with animations, and promotion handling. Coordinates rule evaluation with the chess engine and AI.
frontend/src/features/chess/ui/CapturedP: Displays captured pieces by deriving them from move history and sorting them by piece value.
frontend/src/features/chess/ui/GameStatu: Shows the current game status, turn, check state, and selected settings like board mode and difficulty.
frontend/src/features/chess/ui/MoveHisto: Formats and displays moves in pairs inside a scrollable panel, supporting promotion and castling notation.
frontend/src/features/chess/ui/NewGameBu: Renders a button that triggers a new game callback.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages a backend actor tied to the userâ€™s identity and refreshes dependent queries when it changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides context and hooks for Internet Identity login, logout, and identity state handling.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Placeholder file indicating no backend queries are needed for the chess game.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind base styles and extensive CSS variables for themes, colors, and layout.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with React Query and Internet Identity providers.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures Tailwind with custom colors, fonts, animations, and plugin support.
project_state.json: Contains the current project state for a chess game, including summary, architectural notes, known issues, and a list of implemented features with requirements and versions.
